title: I need a fattish friendly slab serif
content:
Can anyone recommend a nice friendly slab serif that comes in a fairly heavy weight.

Something like Museo, but with slab serifs would be ideal.

thanks!
author: jonathanhughes

comments.content:
I'd recommend FF Tisa, not like museum but friendly contemporary slab! the bold version is pretty heavy, though not fat!!

[www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_tisa\_ot\_bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_tisa_ot_bold/ "www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff\_tisa\_ot\_bold/")
[Caecilia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.linotype.com/1313/pmncaecilia-family.html)? It's got a heavy weight.
Nice stuff. Maybe something even quirkier (like Museo) would fit the bill.

I'm using [Stag](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag/mudTyper+Weights/) a lot at the mo.  
For quirky, you could look at [Akimoto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/hiekkagraphics/akimoto/) or [Black Sabbath](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0133).
[Archer?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100033)
[Enclave Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=47) perhaps?

Try [Neutraface Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutrafaceslab):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Neutra_Slab_Display_Titling_3459.png)

Archer and Caecilia are great. The ball points on Archer are an especially nice characteristic.

I've always loved [Ziggurat](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100028) but I don't know that I'd call it 'friendly':

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ziggurat-01_3791.png)

———————————————————-  
 [Read Between the Leading podcast](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/rbtl.us/) | [Pixelspread](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/pixelspread.com/)

Adding [Soho](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.identifont.com/show?LIR)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SohoProUltra_5740.gif)

and [PF Centro Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.identifont.com/show?PDK) to the list.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CentroSlabProUltraBlack_5218.gif)

Maybe [Dispatch](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.identifont.com/show?8MC) counts as friendly, too:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Dispatch_4576.gif)

Oh, I have forgotten [Sansa Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.ourtype.be/) by Fred Smeijers.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sansa_5656.png)

Well, in this case »Slab« stretches the definition …

Aachen Bold?  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/aachen/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/aachen/bold/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/aachen/bold/")
This is great stuff. Thanks, everyone! I had never seen Sansa Slab before. It's quite nice (true, kind of somewhere between a sans and serif, but quite nice)

Aha, you are looking for the more … hmm … quirky slabs, eh?

Did you notice the »unique« curves of some [Shiretype-Familyfaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042747/http:/www.typography.net/type/font/the_shire_types) from Jeremy Tankard?

Egyptian Wide is a possibility.
